instructions: Fill a jar with water, add a spoonful of glitter, shake the jar to make the glitter swirl, and think about how your mind is like the jar - sometimes it's crazy and chaotic and you can’t see very well, but when the glitter is settled, it sinks and you can see clearly! Use this exercise to remind yourself of this simple but powerful concept!

This exercise concentrates on your hearing and ears. Use an adjustable headset to filter out outside noise. You can then listen to beautiful nature sounds like a bird song! It can help you relax and regain some calm.
Use a sugar-free, dye-free chewing gum. It can give you oral input and help you gain a sense of your own body. If it allows your head to focus and have more clarity, than why not!

Imagine you have a bubble wand with some soapy bubbles. Breathe in and then breathe out whilst being careful not to burst the bubble! Feel the air coming in and out of your mouth and concentrate on your bubble. Breathe in and hold your breath for five seconds and then breathe out to make a bubble, blowing slowly for another five seconds.

Cross your arms in front of you and bring your palms to your sides to squeeze yourself with a big self hug for 10 seconds. You can then open your arms widely which will also release your shoulders! Repeat a few times.
Jump up and down or do jumping jacks for one minute, then sit down and put your hand over your heart, close your eyes and pay attention to your heartbeat and your breath.

Massage your arm up and down starting at your wrist. Do the same thing on your other arm. Concentrate on the feeling of your fingers sqeezing your arms, and after ten times stop and notice - has it made you feel more focused?
Focus on your breath. Imagine a sail boat on your belly that rises and falls with each breath, envision your breath as a colour and pretend you’re a fish breathing air for the first time!
Put your palms together and push and hold for ten seconds. When you are feeling fidgety and emotional about something, this exercise can help you feel your body and awaken your mind.

Starting in the standing position, lean over and put both hands and both feet on the ground. When the area around you is clear, jump with your legs and kick behind you, leaving your hands on the ground.
Start in a squat position and place your hands on the floor in between your knees, like a frog. Using your feet, jump forward and land with your hands and feet on the ground.
